summary: Internal FBI email chain from July 29, 2020, discussing volunteer assistance for the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation. A Special Agent from the TD (likely Tampa Division) offers to help the New York Field Office with evidence preparation, organization, and review for discovery in the high-profile case.

persons.name: SA M
persons.context: Recipient of initial volunteer offer from SA SO-4; appears to be with the New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad.

persons.name: SA SO-4
persons.context: Special Agent from TD (likely Tampa Division) who volunteers to assist the New York Field Office with the Epstein/Maxwell investigation, mentioning they are part of SOG (likely a Special Operations Group).

connections.description: FBI Special Agents from different field offices (TD and NY) coordinating on volunteer assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

events.title: Volunteer Coordination for Investigation
events.description: Internal FBI email exchange where SA SO-4 volunteers to assist the New York Field Office with the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation, specifically with evidence preparation, organization, and review for discovery.

keyFacts: The FBI's New York Field Office (Squad C-20, VCAC/HT) was actively seeking volunteer assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation as of July 2020.
The assistance needed included prepping and organizing evidence for discovery, reviewing items, and listening to recordings.
The case is described as a 'high profile case' and a 'unique opportunity' within the FBI.
The correspondence indicates ongoing investigative activity related to evidence discovery well after Jeffrey Epstein's death in 2019.
